Hi you guys, trying this route first, not sure if you're looking out for email though so may have to give you a ring in a tick...


1)      Katherine and I have used the 'Hub' template to create a homepage, here:



http://londonprepares.kitsite.com/kit/preview/test.html



I think it needs a header and footer though and I don't have access to add those myself. Can we put one in the root folder, will that work?


2)      Sorting out URLs without hyphens as discussed. Are you changing the folder names to do this? I didn't quite understand. If you are then I'm wondering if that means we'll need to rename the headline images in images/headlines so that their file names reflect the new folder names?

Thanks for this Lars

Most important ones for now, ideally fixable before close of play?: 

- Marathon swimming event title isn't appearing in header. Think this may be because homepage is called 'Marathon Swim' but folder and headline image file are called 'MarathonSwimming' now?

- You know the space in the bottom right of all templates where you removed the word Sponsors and the logo spaces? Excluding on the homepage at www.londonpreparesseries.com, please can we put the logo spaces back so we can add them to individual sports sites if need be? We're not adding sponsors but it turns out there's some other organisations who need representing

Others:

- On homepage at www.londonpreparesseries.com can we remove the words 'International Federations' from the bottom left? No logos on that page so no need for the text either.

- Page titles, can these be in the format 'London Prepares series --> Sport name --> Page name' ?


Will send through more as they come in, if you can estimate these in the meantime and ideally action the first 2 if they're not too much trouble that'd be awesome. Know you're busy though so will be realistic

Ta again.

This is fixed now.
Thanks – do you know what the problem was?
( Kieran I would quite like to know this as well if possible ! )

Morag (& Lars),
The website checker works (worked) as follows:
1. Take the user-entered url, and extract the domain name from it. E.g. if the user enters: http://www.cartanglobal.co.nz/path/to/page.html?querystring then we extract "www.cartanglobal.co.nz".
2. If there's a leading "www" then it is stripped (yielding, e.g. "cartanglobal.co.nz").
3. This is then checked against the list of valid sites' valid domain names.

Because "cartanglobal.co.nz" was not in the list, it was not found. "www.cartanglobal.co.nz" was in this list, but ... the above processing ignored it. This was a security decision at the time of development. However, retrospectively it looks a little draconian (and might also lead to editorial confustion). I have now relaxed it slightly meaning that (3.) now works as follows:
3. domain and www.domain are searched for in the list of valid sites' valid domain names.

Incidentally, there is also no need to add the http://domain versions to the list of valid domains. i.e. you can omit the "http://".

I hope this makes sense.

Kieran

From: Liz Goulding
Sent: 30 March 2011 10:39
To: Caroline Hadfield; Roli Barker
Subject: Email update

Hi both,

Here's the scoop:

1.       Budget:  They think it ought to be less than 2 days (£1400), but given that we often ask for lots of tweaks/changes, they are uncomfortable committing to less than that.  So what I propose is a two day cap on the work, but they will actually charge us by the hour ... which could work out to being less than 1 day.  That is how the New Media team work with them on a retainer, so they are very much trustworthy (and I'll watch them).  So if you can ringfence the £1400 for the next week until they complete work, and then raise a PO for the actual amount, hopefully everyone will be happy.

2.       Format: One way of keeping the budget down (it will be much easier for them) is a type of email where the logo comes in embedded as a 'linked image'.  To most users connected to the internet, the email will appear just as you've requested.  The only exception is that if someone downloads all their emails, then turns off their internet connection and tries to look at it, the image won't be there.  It's pretty unusual for people to do that - most people stay connected to the internet when reading their emails - but it is technically possible.  If you are ok with that, then I think we're much more likely to keep it to a day's work.

Let me know if you're happy and I'll get them started!

Liz

P.S.  They're working on the export and 2010 events - it should be fixed today/tomorrow.

To: 'notifications-support@postcms.zendesk.com'
Subject: Commas not appearinf properly

Hi,

I've been trying for ages to get rid of a couple of bad apostrophes in the Did You Know boxes on the Sport pages. I've tried moving them, rewriting them, rewriting the whole sentence and various other things, but to no avail.

For example, for Handball the sentence in CMS reads The ball must be made of pure leather and have a circumference of about 58 - 60cm in the men's competition. In the women's competition, the circumference is 54 - 56cm.
However, when it reaches the live site it reads The ball must be made of pure leather and have a circumference of about 58 - 60cm in the men's competition. In the women's competition, the circumference is 54 - 56cm.

The same thing is happening on the Modern Pentathlon pages.
Greek philosopher Aristotle described competitors in the Pentathlon of the ancient Games as the most 'perfect sportsmen, because in their bodies strength and speed are combined in beautiful harmony'.

I've managed to get rid of the majority of these cases, but I just can't get rid of these two whatever I do! Do you know what is causing these formatting errors, and how they can be fixed? It's getting pretty frustrating!

Thanks,

Michael
